required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Erbium-YAG Laser Versus Platelet Rich Plasma in the Treatment of Atrophic Acne Scars
clinical_study.official_title: Fractional Erbium-YAG Laser Versus Platelet Rich Plasma in the Treatment of Atrophic Acne Scars: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aim to assess the efficacy of Er-YAG laser 2940nm and PRP as a single line of treatment in comparison with combined treatment in atrophic post acne scars.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in grade of acne scares according toQualitative scarring grading system of Goodman and Baron
primary_outcome.description: Grade of acne scares improvement after treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change in clinical appearance of acne scare accordinga four-point scale for assessment of clinical improvement of skin smoothness
primary_outcome.description: improvement of acne scares as evaluated by sequential photos

primary_outcome.measure: Change in patient satisfaction usinga four-point scale; Grade 4 highly satisfied, Grade 3 satisfied, Grade 2 neutral and Grade 1 dissatisfied
primary_outcome.description: increase in patient satisfaction after treatment

arm_group.description: treated with both line of treatments

intervention.description: Multiple sessions of Fractional Erbium Yağ Laser
Multiple injections of Platelet Rich Plasma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with atrophic post acne scars classified on the basis of Goodman and Baron's Qualitative classification, no active acne lesions and patients with atrophic scars only
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with positive history of keloidal tendency, positive history of bleeding tendency, platelet disorder, patients with any acute infection on face like, herpes, folliculitis, patients with HIV, HBsAg, patients with a history of autoimmune diseases or patients on immunosuppressive drugs.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Ass. Prof. of Dermatology, Venereology and Andrology
